(CBS) QUOTE OF THE DAY
“Give a man a fish and he will eat for a day. Teach a man to fish 
      and he will eat for a lifetime. Teach a man to create an artificial 
      shortage of fish and he will eat steak.” - Jay Leno 

DID YOU KNOW? A fetus acquires fingerprints at the age of 
      three months. 

TONIGHT ON THE CBS 
      EVENING NEWS Here's an early look 
      at what we are working on for tonight's broadcast of the CBS Evening News 
      from Anchor and Managing Editor, Katie Couric Hi everyone, 
      With wildfires ravishing the Southeast, a blaze that’s torched a 
      Los Angeles park, a tropical storm lingering off the East Coast and 
      massive flooding in the Midwest, the story of the day is nature’s fury 
      being unleashed on the United States. Cynthia Bowers will 
      report from Missouri, where riverside towns are under several feet of 
      water after at least 20 levees were overtopped, resulting in the worst 
      flooding in more than a decade. The deluge that caused the 
      flooding is a remnant of the storm system that leveled the town of 
      Greensburg, Kansas. President Bush toured the destruction in Greensburg 
      today and Hari Sreenivasan will have that story. On the 
      West Coast, a wildfire is threatening Los Angeles landmarks, including a 
      park's famed conservatory and zoo. Sandra Hughes will have that 
      report. And Bianca Solorzano is on the other side of the country 
      reporting on the massive fires that are working their way through southern 
      Georgia to the northern border of Florida. Meanwhile, Vice 
      President Dick Cheney is in Baghdad, on a surprise stop to urge Iraq's 
      warring factions to find more common ground. Mark Strassmann is 
      there and will have our report. What's the newest popular export 
      from China? Its language. American students are learning Mandarin in 
      droves, and it's becoming a popular subject in schools from Maryland to 
      Washington state. Barry Petersen will report on the programs and 
      their wide appeal in America. Finally, we’re going to introduce 
      you to a poet whose services reach an unusual market – the supermarket. 
      Zach Houston hawks his wares, commissioned poems, outside of grocery 
      stores in Berkeley, California. He may not be a Wordsworth, but what comes 
      out of this wordsmith’s typewriter just might surprise you. John 
      Blackstone will have the story. I hope you’ll join us, 
      Katie For more on two of the stories noted above, please 
      click on the following links... Failing Levees Spur Major 
      Missouri Floods Click Here Bush Tours Town Wiped 
      Out By Tornado Click Here Here's a look at one 
      of the stories we are working on for Thursday's broadcast of the CBS 
      EVENING NEWS...A quality-of-life decision for women -- stay on the 
      CAREER track .. OR, "opt out" of work .. to raise a family. We'll look at 
      whether it's REALLY a matter of choice. That story and much more on 
      Thursday night's broadcast of the CBS EVENING NEWS. If you would 
      like more information on any of these stories or the broadcast, please 
      click on the following address and e-mail us: evening@cbsnews.com 
      

TONIGHT ON DAVID LETTERMAN Join Dave tonight on 
      The Late Show with actress Lindsay Lohan 
      AND comedian Tom Dreesen… Plus, musical guests The Kooks! 

THURSDAY MORNING ON THE EARLY SHOW Harry Smith, 
      Hannah Storm, Julie Chen and Russ Mitchellanchor 
      THE EARLY SHOW from New York. Dave 
      Price will bring us the weather. Along with the top news of 
      the day, we will also have the following stories: OBSESSIVE 
      LOVE WITH DR. PHIL: On his talk show, Dr. Phil dishes out tough love. 
      His latest series takes a look at love to the extreme. Obsessive love when 
      loving someone includes jealousy and obsessive tendencies. Dr. Phil tried 
      to help one husband who is very obsessive of his wife of eleven years. 
      Thursday morning, Dr. Phil will join us with advice if you or someone you 
      love has taken things a bit too far. CSI WEEK: CSI SET 
      VISIT: This season of CSI has given us everything from a Big 
      Romance between Grissom and Sara... to a so-called "Miniature Killer." All 
      season long, the killer left-behind a scale-model miniature of the crime 
      scene. The cast told our own Julie Chen that those models were as 
      fascinating for them as they were for the fans. Thursday morning, we’ll 
      have a preview of the big season finale from stars Marg Helgenberger and 
      William Petersen! MOTHER’S DAY EDITION OF MONEY MATTERS: In 
      honor of mother’s day, financial expert Ray Martin will join us 
      with tips. If you are a stay at home mom, how can you be sure you are 
      making the most of your dollar? And for working moms, how can you maximize 
      your pay and keep everyone at home healthy and happy? Thursday morning, 
      Ray will have advice for every type of mom. CAN TOYS MAKE YOUR 
      BABY SMARTER?: Educational videos, music, flash cards, computer 
      programs, toys that beep, talk and light up - there's no shortage of 
      products designed to transform our infants and toddlers into little 
      geniuses. But, investigative journalist Susan Gregory Thomas believes that 
      these products may not deliver what they promise. She has written about 
      them in her new book, Buy, Buy Baby and will join us Thursday 
      morning with advice. MITCH ALBOM PICKS THE WINNING MOM 
      ESSAY: Last month, author of For One More Day, Mitch Albom, 
      joined us to launch a contest about the Times Mom Stood Up For Me timed to 
      coincide with mother’s day. The top ten finalists were picked, and now 
      Albom has chosen the winner. Thursday morning, Albom will join us to 
      reveal the winner. The winner will receive a seven-night cruise vacation 
      for two from Royal Caribbean International. WILLIAMS SONOMA 
      MOTHERS DAY LUNCH: What better way to feed mom than with a perfect 
      menu of things she'll love: blue cheese in a fondue, a light chicken 
      salad, and a creamy fruit dessert. Our friend and cookbook author Tori 
      Ritchie will show us a lunch that is sure to please mom. If 
      you would like more information on any of these stories or the broadcast, 
      please click on the following address and e-mail us: earlyshow@cbs.com
